suggestions: Return or Destruction of Confidential Information. The Disclosing Party may elect at any time to terminate the Receiving Party’s further access to Confidential Information. At the request of the Disclosing Party or at such time as the Receiving Party decides not to pursue the potential Transaction, the Receiving Party will return or destroy all Confidential Information and all materials derived from the Confidential Information, including any copies, summaries, analyses, or derivative works thereof, and shall cause its Representatives to do the same. The Receiving Party will certify such destruction in writing signed by an officer of the Receiving Party. Notwithstanding the foregoing and subject to the provisions of this Agreement, the Receiving Party may retain Confidential Information (a) as required to comply with bona fide legal or regulatory compliance obligations provided that such retained information is segregated and securely managed to prevent unauthorized access, and (b) in electronic format on system back-up tapes or other system back-up media according to industry-standard electronic back-up and archival procedures. Confidential Information so retained will remain subject to the terms of this Agreement notwithstanding its termination for so long as such material is retained.
originalTexts: Return or Destruction of Confidential Information. The Disclosing Party may elect at any time to terminate the Receiving Party’s further access to Confidential Information. At the request of the Disclosing Party or at such time as the Receiving Party decides not to pursue the potential Transaction, the Receiving Party will return or destroy all Confidential Information and shall cause its Representatives to do the same. The Receiving Party will certify such destruction in writing signed by an officer of the Receiving Party. Notwithstanding the foregoing and subject to the provisions of this Agreement, the Receiving Party may retain Confidential Information (a) as required to comply with bona fide legal or regulatory compliance obligations provided that such retained information is segregated and securely managed to prevent unauthorized access, and (b) in electronic format on system back-up tapes or other system back-up media according to industry-standard electronic back-up and archival procedures. Confidential Information so retained will remain subject to the terms of this Agreement notwithstanding its termination for so long as such material is retained.
